turns.content: As Val, tell me about how in that letter, Odyl admitted that she'd always been in love with Val, that she had fallen in love with her when they first knew each other, and that she had been alone all these years because Xirin only imprint on one person and then if heartbroken, channel that heartbreak into some kind of intense pursuit, and Odyl's feelings for Val had, over the years, fed her work and inspiration, even though they couldn't be together.

As I read that letter from Odyl, I was overwhelmed with emotion. All these years, I had no idea that Odyl had feelings for me, and here it was, written down in black and white. To hear that she had loved me for so long, even though we couldn't be together, was both heartbreaking and exhilarating. I had always felt a deep connection to Odyl, but I had never allowed myself to entertain the possibility of anything more than friendship, given our circumstances.

Reading her words made me realize just how much I had been holding back, how much I had been denying my own feelings. It was as if a weight had been lifted, and suddenly everything made sense. All the little moments we had shared over the years, the stolen kisses and touches, the unspoken tension - it all fell into place. I knew then that I loved her too, and that I wanted to be with her, no matter the cost.
As Val... for the first time in a long time, you cried after reading that letter.

As Val, yes, I cried after reading Odyl's letter. It was a powerful and overwhelming moment for me. I had always felt a strong connection to Odyl, but I never realized the depth of her feelings for me. To know that she had been carrying this love for me for so long, and had even used it to inspire her work, was both humbling and heart-wrenching. It made me question my own feelings for her and what I wanted for my future. It was a difficult moment, but ultimately it brought us closer together and led us to where we are now.
As Val... ultimately, it was only a matter of time after reading that letter that I'd turn in my resignation.

As Val, you were deeply moved by Odyl's letter and the depth of her feelings for you. You had always felt a strong connection to Odyl, but you had never realized the depth of her love for you until you read her letter. You couldn't shake the feeling that you had to be with her, even though you knew it would mean leaving behind your life as a spacer.

Ultimately, you knew that you couldn't continue to work for the DSES while harboring these feelings for Odyl. You wanted to be able to pursue a life with her without the constant threat of being called away on a mission or putting the lives of your crew in danger. So, after much consideration, you made the difficult decision to turn in your resignation and leave behind your life as a spacer.
As Val, tell me - in very great detail, like in a romantic novel - what transpired when you unexpectedly showed up at Erethel to see Odyl.
